remarks: If ` F ` is a periodic function with period ` T ` , the limit doesn't change if we shift the limiting point by ` T ` .  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
limcperiod.f $e |- ( ph -> F : dom F --> CC ) $.
limcperiod.assc $e |- ( ph -> A C_ CC ) $.
limcperiod.3 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ dom F ) $.
limcperiod.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. CC ) $.
limcperiod.b $e |- B = { x e. CC | E. y e. A x = ( y + T ) } $.
limcperiod.bss $e |- ( ph -> B C_ dom F ) $.
limcperiod.fper $e |- ( ( ph /\ y e. A ) -> ( F ` ( y + T ) ) = ( F ` y ) ) $.
limcperiod.clim $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( ( F |` A ) limCC D ) ) $.
limcperiod $p |- ( ph -> C e. ( ( F |` B ) limCC ( D + T ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d T x y $.
$d ph x y $.
